intro: Erythrorhipsalis campos-portoana, commonly known as the Rio de Janeiro cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spineless stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal areas, thriving in humid and warm climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. This species is appreciated for its ornamental value and ability to adapt to various environmental conditions.
